facts.1: World Emoji Day is celebrated on July 17th because the calendar emoji shows the date July 17.
facts.2: The day is observed to celebrate the use of emojis and their impact on digital communication worldwide.
facts.3: It was created in 2014 by Jeremy Burge, the founder of Emojipedia.

facts.1: Constitution Day in South Korea commemorates the promulgation of the Republic of Korea Constitution, which took effect on July 17, 1948.
facts.2: Although it is no longer a public holiday since 2008, it remains a significant day in South Korean history.
facts.3: The constitution has since undergone several major revisions, reflecting the nation's political development.

facts.1: The Day of International Criminal Justice marks the anniversary of the adoption of the treaty that created the International Criminal Court (ICC) on July 17, 1998.
facts.2: It aims to promote international awareness and support for justice and for the victims of crimes that are of concern to the international community.
facts.3: NGOs and governments use this day to unite in support of the ICC and to recognize the efforts of individuals and organizations that fight to bring perpetrators of international crimes to justice.
